embeds.title: Slimed Tail
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Whenever you Split, gain 3 **Block** :p_block:.
*A fake tail to trick enemies during combat, completely covered in slime.*

messages.content: Slime Boss's version of <tough bandages>

embeds.title: Tough Bandages
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Whenever you discard a card during your turn, gain 3 **Block** :p_block:.
*Loss gives strength.*

messages.content: god this relic is so useless
you're not splitting five times a turn
you're splitting maybe once or twice in a combat
Unlike tough bandages this should be rare
"maybe 9 block in a combat max" "rare"
<captain's wheel> which is a "bad rare" btw

embeds.title: Captain's Wheel
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / All / Slay the Spire

At the start of your 3rd turn, gain 18 **Block** :p_block:.
*Wooden trinket carved with delicate precision. A name is carved into it but the language is foreign.*

messages.content: and <red scarf>

embeds.title: Red Scarf
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Hermit / Downfall

Whenever you apply a debuff to an enemy, gain 2 **Block** :p_block:.
*It's warm and fuzzy.*

messages.content: and red scarf is actually decent

>splitting maybe once or twice a combat
_you're_ maybe splitting once or twice a combat
you are?
is this a your you're thing
I'm saying that's a problem specific to your playstyle
okay with which cards are you splitting that many times
because split does nothing turn of, glop chop is rare, and everything else exhausts

absorbing good, absorbing requires more splitting, things exhausting is _not_ a problem -

overall I find myself splitting twice per turn - some less some more - just to feed things like Protect the Boss or Repurpose or Slime Tap
okay with which cards are you splitting with
if you're not playing for slimes, then yeah, this relic does nothing
whatever I can get my hands on
exhausting strike pluses :dead:
exhausting strike pluses that channel lightning pluses that give you strength when evoked
playstyle difference
8 (16) damage and 5 (10) block >>>> 1 strength
on a character with no multihits
You can discard multiple cards for 1 or even 0 energy without exhaust. Regardless of playstyle this should not have the same numbers
You can also play a power to discard every turn for the rest of combat
slimed tail… is not actually very good
maybe uncommon at best
I probably split maybe 3-4 times per combat, so not that useful, definitely not at the power of other rare relics though
generally I would much rather have supply scroll or captain's wheel
Even if your acutally running a lot of slime generation, getting a lot of block from this is very optimistic.

In the ideal situation you have something like duplicated form with glop chop and another slime card, so thats 9 block a turn. But its also pretty normal for this to end up only providing 3 block every 2 turns; putting it far below thread and needle and every other rare block relic.
This does make darklings block for 9 though; which is the best use the relic will have in a normal run (since darklings is a pretty good card to take even in a normal deck)

It's not great. You definitely can lean into a split heavy deck, especially if you are running a lot of cards that rely on absorbing slimes (slime tap, protect the boss, mass repurpose, serve and protect, divide and conquer) or having many slimes out (slime brawl). There is an issue in that many of those cards exhaust, and that many of the slime making cards exhaust, which makes them better for short bursts in hallway fights, but can leave you wanting in longer elite and boss fights. They also have to compete with the generically powerful strategy of sitting on multiple leeching slimes (and sometimes mire slimes) to get consistent, repeated value every turn, including a solid block engine. 

Where this can get interesting is with a heavy split deck using strange spoon to help give longevity to some of the exhausting cards, especially divide and conquer to make use of the absorbed strength. However, that's a very tough deck to get into, and I don't think it's an optimal strategy to be looking for. Most decks simply aren't going to be splitting often enough to get much value out of slimed tail, and if you get it randomly from a chest or elite, it can feel pretty bad, because it's rather difficult to pivot into supporting it, and often not worth it. It's difficult to buy it from a shop, it's going to be quite expensive as a rare, and you kind of want to make sure you have decent support for it before making that investment, which you likely won't have. it I think the average deck will struggle to trigger this more than 3-4 times in a fight, which does make it well below average. Simply put, it's pretty tough to split 2+ times a turn unless you find some very specific cards that aren't generally optimal, and if you are splitting multiple times per turn, then you can't sit on leeching slimes value, which awkwardly happens to provide a much more smooth, consistent, and powerful block engine.

I think this relic fundamentally doesn't make sense within the cardpool/mechanics of slime boss, it wants to be a block engine, but most of the ways of triggering it exhaust, so you almost have to find strange spoon as well, and the odds of finding a specific shop relic are very low considering how many of them there are, and only getting to see 1 per shop.

messages.content: clearly you just need <goop dweller> <jeremiah’s banner> <greed ooze> *and* <scrap ooze type=relic>, anchor value

embeds.title: Goop Dweller
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

At the start of combat, **Split** into a **Bru​iser** Slime.
*He followed me home. Can I keep it?*

embeds.title: Jeremiah's Banner
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

At the start of combat, gain 1 Slime slot and **Split** into a random Slime.
*You and ooze army.*

embeds.title: Greed Ooze
embeds.description:
Special Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

At the start of combat, spawn Greed Ooze.
At Rest Sites, Greed Ooze will take 50 of your souls :p_gold:, increasing its damage by 1.
When Greed Ooze is absorbed gain Revive Greed.
Revive Greed (2 (1) :energy_slime: ): **Retain**. Split into Greed Ooze. **Exhaust**.
*A friend found in the Spire who devours souls.*

embeds.title: Scrap Ooze
embeds.description:
Special Relic / The Slime Boss / Downfall

At the start of combat, spawn Scrap Ooze (can be revived if Absorbed).
At Rest Sites, you can donate a card to the Scrap Ooze, modifying its damage:
+1 damage for Uncommons
+2 damage for Rares
-1 damage for Commons
-2 damage for **Curse**s
**

messages.content: Nothing is stopping you from taking like 10 of the common split cards, with even a tiniest bit of efficiency they're worth for the commands alone
But I agree that the relic rarity isn't justified
It'd be a lot better if it gave like 2 block on command
